Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Moreover , further ARSA alleles functionally similar to A464V might exist which , together with 0 - type mutations , may cause pathological ARSA and GS levels , but not clinical outbreak of the disease . .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| ARSA disease |
| Clinical outbreak of the disease |

In this paragraph, the diseases mentioned are "ARSA disease" and "clinical outbreak of the disease." The first disease is explicitly stated as "pathological ARSA," but since "ARSA" is mentioned as the disease caused by the ARSA alleles and mutations, it can be inferred that "ARSA disease" is the overarching condition. The second disease, "clinical outbreak," is mentioned as a potential consequence of the pathological ARSA, but it is not explicitly stated that it is a separate disease entity. However, for the sake of clarity and precision, it is listed as a separate disease entity in the table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| ARSA disease |

In the revised table, only "ARSA disease" is listed as it is the only entity in the paragraph that clearly refers to a disease. The term "clinical outbreak" is not a disease but rather a potential consequence or manifestation of ARSA disease.
